title: M 4.2 earthquake near Etna
description: Seismic event detected with magnitude 4.2 at shallow depth near Mount Etna's southeast crater

discussion.author: u_dr_rossi
discussion.body: This M 4.2 event shows typical characteristics of volcanic-tectonic earthquakes. The shallow depth and location suggest it's related to magma movement.

discussion.author: u_dr_bianchi
discussion.body: Agreed. The seismic signature aligns with our recent InSAR data showing ground deformation in this sector.

discussion.author: u_prof_ferrari
discussion.body: I've updated the hazard assessment. Recommend increasing monitoring frequency for this sector.

title: Stromboli eruption phase
description: Extended strombolian activity with lava fountains and persistent explosive activity

uniqueData.description: Extended strombolian activity with lava fountains

discussion.author: u_dr_moretti
discussion.body: Current activity shows sustained lava fountaining from the NE crater. Wind conditions are dispersing ash to the southeast.

discussion.author: u_dr_rossi
discussion.body: Explosion frequency has increased to ~15 per hour. This is above the baseline of 8-10/hour.

discussion.author: u_prof_ferrari
discussion.body: Tourist access to crater rim should remain restricted. Activity level warrants continued orange alert status.

title: Gas emission spike at Vulcano
description: Significant increase in SO2 emissions detected at La Fossa crater, 600% above background levels

discussion.author: u_dr_bianchi
discussion.body: This is the highest SO2 flux we've recorded since 2018. Correlates with increased fumarole temperatures.

discussion.author: u_dr_rossi
discussion.body: Wind direction is favorable - emissions dispersing offshore. No immediate health concerns for Porto di Levante.

title: Campi Flegrei ground uplift
description: Continued caldera-wide uplift detected through InSAR monitoring, reaching 3.2 cm maximum displacement

discussion.author: u_prof_ferrari
discussion.body: Weekly displacement rate is accelerating. We're seeing 2-3mm/week compared to 1mm/week last month.

discussion.author: u_dr_moretti
discussion.body: Seismic data supports the InSAR observations. Low-frequency events are increasing in the central caldera.

discussion.author: u_dr_bianchi
discussion.body: Civil protection has been briefed. Yellow alert status remains appropriate but we're monitoring closely.

title: Etna microearthquake swarm
description: Grouped event series with 5 related occurrences indicating potential pre-eruptive activity

discussion.author: u_dr_moretti
discussion.body: This swarm pattern is consistent with dyke intrusion at shallow depth. Similar to the precursory activity we saw in 2023.

discussion.author: u_dr_rossi
discussion.body: Agreed. The depth clustering around 8-9km suggests a common source. Should we increase network sensitivity?

discussion.author: u_prof_ferrari
discussion.body: Yes, recommend activating additional temporary stations in the SE sector for better location accuracy.
